member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.DataFormat
member.summary: The format of the data to expect or use on a play or record function

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DataFormat.Raw
member.summary: The data file or buffer contains raw data only.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DataFormat.Wave
member.summary: The data file or buffer contains standard wav headers.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DataFormat.Vap
member.summary: A data file or buffer of indexed voice segments

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.Codec
member.summary: The codec to use when playing, recording or streaming voice data.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.Automatic
member.summary: For playing, the voice format is automatically determined if possible. For recording, MULAW_8KHZ_8BIT is the default.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_ADPCM_6Khz_4Bit
member.summary: ADPCM 6Khz, 4Bit (24 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record. Maps to CTI32 Format: Kbps24

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_ADPCM_8Khz_4Bit
member.summary: ADPCM 8Khz, 4Bit (32 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record. Maps to CTI32 Format: Kbps32

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_PCM_6Khz_8Bit
member.summary: PCM 6Khz, 8Bit (48 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_PCM_8Khz_8Bit
member.summary: PCM 8Khz, 8Bit (64 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record. Maps to CTI Format: Kbps64

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_PCM_ALAW_6Khz_8Bit
member.summary: PCM ALAW 6Khz, 8Bit (48 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record. Supported by D/41ESC, D/160SC-LS, D/240SC, D/240SC-T1, D/300SC-E1 and D/320SC boards only.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.Codec.DXPR_PCM_ALAW_8Khz_8Bit
member.summary: PCM ALAW 8Khz, 8Bit (64 Kb/s) using dx_play or dx_record. Supported by D/41ESC, D/160SC-LS, D/240SC, D/240SC-T1, D/300SC-E1 and D/320SC boards only.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.TerminationCode.OtherError

member.summary: Successful - No call progress - successful.

member.summary: Perfectcall cadence break.

member.summary: Perfectcall loop current drop.

member.summary: Human answered. Positive Voice Detect.

member.summary: Answering machine answered. Positive Answering Machine Detect.

member.summary: Connected to PBX.

member.summary: Line was busy.

member.summary: Nobody answered the phone.

member.summary: Never heard any ringing going on.

member.summary: That tone you get: be-be-beep. When the number is no good.

member.summary: No dial tone detected.

member.summary: A fax tone was detected.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialResult.Error
member.summary: An unknown error occurred.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialResult.Failed
member.summary: Failed.

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.FormatSpoken
member.summary: Indicates the format to be spoken when playing numbers and dates.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.FormatSpoken.Standard
member.summary: Plays a number or date in standard fashion. I.E. 1002.5 yeilds "one zero zero two point five".

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.FormatSpoken.Intelligently
member.summary: Plays a number or date intelligently. I.E. 1002.5 yeilds "one thousand two point five".

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.FormatSpoken.Currency
member.summary: Plays numbers as currency. I.E. 12.5 yeilds "twelve dollars and fifty cents".

member.summary: Indicates the type of Qos Event Received

member.summary: Indicates Jitter

member.summary: Indicates Round Trip Latency Problems

member.summary: Indicates Rtcp Timeout

member.summary: Indicates Rtp Timeout

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.DialReturnType
member.summary: Returns the result of the success conditions for the dialer commands.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialReturnType.Successful
member.summary: The successful call condition was met.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialReturnType.Expired
member.summary: The CallExpires condition was met.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialReturnType.ConditionNotMet
member.summary: The successful call condition was no tmet

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialReturnType.Cancelled
member.summary: The Call was cancelled

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.DialType
member.summary: The dial type to use.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialType.Sequential
member.summary: Means that we will call one after another.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialType.Simultaneous
member.summary: Means that we will call all at once.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialType.Single
member.summary: Means that we will call one at a time.

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.DialMode
member.summary: The type of Dial Mode to use when using the abstract Dialer class.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialMode.Queued
member.summary: Means that we use a queue to manage the dials.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.DialMode.Direct
member.summary: Means that we use a direct call.

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.CallPriority
member.summary: The priority of the call.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallPriority.Low
member.summary: Indicates a low priority call. All normal and high priority requests will dial before low requests.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallPriority.Normal
member.summary: Indicates a normal priority call. This is the default. All high priority requests will dial before normal requests.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallPriority.High
member.summary: Indicates a high priority call. High priority requests will dial before all others.

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria
member.summary: The sucess conditions for a call or set of calls.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria.HumanDetected
member.summary: The call will be considered a success when a human is detected.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria.MachineDetected
member.summary: The call will be considered a success when a machine is detected.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria.DTMF
member.summary: The call will be considered a success when the DTMF digit in AcceptableDigits is entered by the user.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria.Connected
member.summary: The call will be considered a success if a dial result of connected is returned.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.SuccessCriteria.HumanOrMachineDetected
member.summary: The call will be considered a success if either a human or machine is detected.

member.param: The filename in which you would like to read the comment.

member.summary: Writes the comment into the file.
member.param: The filename that you would like to write the comment to.

member.name: T:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters
member.summary: Contains the various user defined call progress values. If set to 0, the default for the parameter is used.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_nbrdna
member.summary: # of rings before no answer. Number of Rings Before Detecting No Answer: The number of single or double rings to wait before returning a no answer. Default: 4.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_stdely
member.summary: Delay after dialing before analysis. Start Delay: The delay after dialing has been completed and before starting Frequency Detection. This parameter also determines the start of Cadence Detection and Positive Voice Detection. Default: 25 (10 ms units). Note that this can affect detection of the first element of an operator intercept tone.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_cnosig
member.summary: Duration of no signal time out delay. Continuous No Signal. The maximum time of silence (no signal) allowed immediately after cadence detection begins. If exceeded, a “no ringback” is returned. Default: 4000 Units: 10 msec

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lcdly
member.summary: Delay after dial before lc drop connect Loop Current Delay: The delay after dialing has been completed and before beginning Loop Current Detection. To disable Loop Current Detection, set to -1. Default: 400 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lcdly1
member.summary: Delay after lc drop con. before msg. Loop Current Delay 1: The delay after Loop Current Detection detects a transient drop in loop current and before Call Analysis returns a connect to the application. Default: 10 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_hedge
member.summary: Edge of answer to send connect message. Hello Edge: The point at which a connect will be returned to the application, either the rising edge (immediately when a connect is detected) or the falling edge (after the end of the salutation). 1 = rising edge. 2 = falling edge. Default: 2 (connect returned on falling edge of salutation). Try changing this if the called party has to say "Hello" twice to trigger the answer event.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_cnosil
member.summary: Initial continuous noise timeout delay. Continuous Nonsilence: The maximum length of nonsilence allowed. If exceeded, a no ringback is returned. Default: 650 (in 10 ms units), or 6.5 seconds.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo1tola
member.summary: % acceptable pos. dev of public ushort low sig.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo1tolb
member.summary: % acceptable neg. dev of public ushort low sig.

member.summary: % acceptable pos. dev of long low sig.

member.summary: % acceptable neg. dev of long low sig.

member.summary: % acceptable pos. dev of high signal.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_hi1tolb
member.summary: % acceptable neg. dev of high signal.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo1bmax
member.summary: Maximum interval for shrt low for busy.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo2bmax
member.summary: Maximum interval for long low for busy.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_hi1bmax
member.summary: Maximum interval for 1st high for busy

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_nsbusy
member.summary: Num. of highs after nbrdna busy check. Nonsilence Busy: The number of nonsilence periods in addition to ca_nbrdna to wait before returning a busy. Default: 0. ca_nsbusy is added to ca_nbrdna to give the actual number of busy cadences at which to return busy. Note that even though ca_nsbusy is declared as an unsigned variable, it can be a small negative number. Do not allow ca_nbrdna + ca_nsbusy to equal 2. This is a foible of the 2's complement bit mapping of a small negative number to an unsigned variable.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_logltch
member.summary: Silence deglitch duration. Low Glitch: The maximum silence period to ignore. Used to help eliminate spurious silence intervals. Default: 15 (in 10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_higltch
member.summary: Non-silence deglitch duration. High Glitch: The maximum nonsilence period to ignore. Used to help eliminate spurious nonsilence intervals. Default: 19 (in 10 ms units)

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo1rmax
member.summary: Max. public ushort low dur. of double ring.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo2rmin
member.summary: Min. long low dur. of double ring.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_intflg
member.summary: Operator intercept mode. Intercept Mode Flag. Enables or disables SIT frequency detection, positive voice detection (PVD), and/or positive answering machine detection (PAMD), and selects the mode of operation for SIT frequency detection. • DX_OPTDIS – Disable SIT frequency detection, PAMD, and PVD. This setting provides call progress without SIT frequency detection. • DX_OPTNOCON – Enable SIT frequency detection and return an “intercept” immediately after detecting a valid frequency. This setting provides call progress with SIT frequency detection. • DX_PVDENABLE – Enable PVD and fax tone detection. This setting provides PVD call analysis only (no call progress). • DX_PVDOPTNOCON – Enable PVD, DX_OPTNOCON, and fax tone detection. This setting provides call progress with SIT frequency detection and PVD call analysis. • DX_PAMDENABLE – Enable PAMD, PVD, and fax tone detection. This setting provides PAMD and PVD call analysis only (no call progress). • DX_PAMDOPTEN – Enable PAMD, PVD, DX_OPTNOCON, and fax tone detection. This setting provides full call progress and call analysis. Default: DX_OPTNOCON

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_intfltr
member.summary: Minimum signal to qualify freq. detect.

member.summary: reserved for future use

member.summary: reserved for future use

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_hisiz
member.summary: Used to determine which lowmax to use.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_alowmax
member.summary: Max. low before con. if high GT hisize.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_blowmax
member.summary: Max. low before con. if high LT hisize.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_nbrbeg
member.summary: Number of rings before analysis begins.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_hi1ceil
member.summary: Maximum 2nd high dur. for a retrain.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lo1ceil
member.summary: Maximum 1st low dur. for a retrain.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lowerfrq
member.summary: Lower allowable frequency in hz. Lower Frequency: Lower bound for first tone in Hz. Default: 900.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_upperfrq
member.summary: Upper allowable frequency in hz. Upper Frequency: Upper bound for first tone in Hz. Default: 1000. Adjust higher for additional operator intercept tones.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_timefrq
member.summary: Total duration of good signal required. Time Frequency: Minimum time for first tone to remain in bounds. The minimum amount of time required for the audio signal to remain within the frequency detection range for it to be detected. The audio signal must not be greater than ca_upperfrq or lower than ca_lowerfrq for at least the time interval specified in ca_timefrq. Default: 5 (10 ms units)

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_rejctfrq
member.summary: Allowable % of bad signal. (Not Used)

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_maxansr
member.summary: Maximum duration of answer. Maximum Answer: The maximum allowable length of ansrsize. When ansrsize exceeds ca_maxansr, a connect is returned to the application. Default: 1000 (in 10 ms units), or 10 seconds.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_ansrdgl
member.summary: Silence deglitching value for answer. Answer Deglitcher: The maximum silence period (in 10 ms units) allowed between words in a salutation. This parameter should be enabled only when you are interested in measuring the length of the salutation. Default: -1 (disabled).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_mxtimefrq
member.summary: max time for 1st freq to remain in bounds Maximum Time Frequency: Maximum allowable time for first tone to be present. Default: 0 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lower2frq
member.summary: Lower Bound for second Frequency: Lower bound for second tone in Hz. Default: 0

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_upper2frq
member.summary: Upper Bound for second Frequency: Upper bound for second tone in Hz. Default: 0.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_time2frq
member.summary: min time for 2nd freq to remains in bounds Time for second Frequency: Minimum time for second tone to remain in bounds. Default: 0 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_mxtime2frq
member.summary: max time for 2nd freq to remain in bounds Maximum Time for second Frequency: Maximum allowable time for second tone to be present. Default: 0 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_lower3frq
member.summary: Lower Bound for third Frequency: Lower bound for third tone in Hz. Default: 0.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_upper3frq
member.summary: Upper Bound for third Frequency: Upper bound for third tone in Hz. Default: 0.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_time3frq
member.summary: min time for 3rd freq to remains in bounds Time for third Frequency: Minimum time for third tone to remain in bounds. Default: 0 (10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_mxtime3frq
member.summary: max time for 3rd freq to remain in bounds Maximum Time for third Frequency: Maximum allowable time for third tone to be present. Default: 0 (10 ms units)

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_dtn_pres
member.summary: Length of a valid dial tone (def=1sec) Dial Tone Present: The length of time that the dial tone must be continuously present (in 10 ms units). If a dial tone is present for this amount of time, dialing of the dial string proceeds. Default value: 100 (one second).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_dtn_npres
member.summary: Max time to wait for dial tone (def=3sec) Dial Tone Not Present: The length of time to wait before declaring the dial tone not present (in 10 ms units). If a dial tone of sufficient length (ca_dtn_pres) is not found within this period of time, Call Analysis terminates with the reason CR_NODIALTONE. The dial tone character (L, I, or X) for the missing dial tone can be obtained using ATDX_DTNFAIL( ). Default value: 300 (three seconds).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_dtn_deboff
member.summary: The dialtone off debouncer (def=100ms) Dial Tone Debounce: The maximum duration of a break in an otherwise continuous dial tone before it is considered invalid (in 10 ms units). This parameter is used for ignoring short drops in dial tone. If a drop longer than ca_dtn_deboff occurs, then dial tone is no longer considered present, and another dial tone must begin and be continuous for ca_dtn_pres. Default value: 10 (100 msec).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_pamd_failtime
member.summary: Wait for AMD/PVD after cadence break(default=4sec) PAMD Fail Time. Maximum time to wait for positive answering machine detection or positive voice detection after a cadence break. Default: 400 Units: 10 msec

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_pamd_minring
member.summary: min allowable ring duration (def=1.9sec) Minimum PAMD ring: Minimum allowable ring duration for Positive Answering Machine Detection. Default Value: 190 (in 10 ms units).

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_pamd_spdval
member.summary: Set to 2 selects quick decision (def=1) PAMD Speed Value. Quick or full evaluation for PAMD detection • PAMD_FULL – Full evaluation of response • PAMD_QUICK – Quick look at connect circumstances • PAMD_ACCU – Recommended setting. Does the most accurate evaluation detecting live voice as accurately as PAMD_FULL but is more accurate than PAMD_FULL (although slightly slower) in detecting an answering machine. Use PAMD_ACCU when accuracy is more important than speed. Default: PAMD_ACCU

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_pamd_qtemp
member.summary: The Qualification template to use for PAMD PAMD Qualification Template: The algorithm to use in PAMD. At present there is only one template: PAMD_QUAL1TMP. This parameter must be set to this value.

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_noanswer
member.summary: time before no answer after first ring (default=30sec) No Answer. Length of time to wait after first ringback before deciding that the call is not answered. Default: 3000 Units: 10 msec

member.name: F:VoiceElements.Common.CallAnalysisParameters.ca_maxintering
member.summary: Max inter ring delay before connect (8 sec) Maximum Inter-ring: The maximum length of time to wait between consecutive ringback signals (in 10 ms units). If this duration is exceeded, Call Analysis is terminated with the reason CR_CONN (connected). Default value: 800 (8 seconds).
